attributes.action: Class the deceit used in the EU referendum campaigning as election fraud
attributes.additional_details: Many of the core arguments used in the campaign have been proven to be false or admitted to being incorrect post referendum. These include the immediate impact on the UK economy;  the weekly UK cost of EU membership; and promises that all retained money would be spent on the NHS.  Other persuasive misconceptions were also peddled during the campaign, such as a separate UK being certain to significantly limit immigration and the European parliament being unelected.
attributes.background: The electorate was deliberately misled and many are now discovering they have voted for something different to what they thought they were voting for.  We are outraged by this dishonest campaigning, and believe it should be treated in the same way as election fraud, and the result disregarded

rejection.details:
Electoral fraud is already defined in law, and can involve criminal offences. You can find out more about electoral fraud here:

http://www.electoralcommission.org.uk/__data/assets/pdf_file/0005/149729/List-of-electoral-offences.pdf

If you would like Parliament to change the law on electoral fraud, you could start a new petition calling for the specific change you want to see.
